3 cars per set, 2 sets per train |linelength = {{convert|28.2|km|mi|1|abbr=on}} |notrack = 2 |gauge = {{RailGauge|sg}} |speed = 80 km/h |el = [[Third rail]] (750 [[volt]]s [[Direct Current|DC]]) |map = }} {{Chinese|t=èç·|p=LÃ¡n-XiÃ n|tp=LÃ¡n-SiÃ n|w=Lan2- Hsien4|poj=NÃ¢-SoÃ â¿}} The [[Taipei Rapid Transit System|Taipei Metro]] '''Blue Line''' is a high-capacity [[rapid transit]] line comprises three lines: the [[Nangang Line (TRTS)|Nangang Line]], the [[Banqiao Line (TRTS)|Banqiao Line]], and the [[Tucheng Line (TRTS)|Tucheng Line]]. The lines are divided at [[Ximen Station]] and [[Fuzhong Station]], and offer through traffic to one another. When fully completed, it will have a total of 23 stations serving the [[Nangang District, Taipei|Nangang]], [[Xinyi District|Xinyi]], [[Daan District|Daan]], [[Zhongshan District, Taipei|Zhonghsan]], and [[Wanhua District|Wanhua]] districts, as well as into the [[New Taipei]] districts of [[Banqiao District|Banqiao]] and [[Tucheng District|Tucheng]]. The '''Ban'''qiao and '''Nan'''gang Lines are collectively called the '''Bannan Line'''. The entire line runs underground. The excavation of tunnels using the cut-and-cover method resulted in large scale detouring of road traffic. Because of that, the line runs beneath existing roads and totals {{convert|28.3|km|mi|abbr=on}}. ==Overview== Current services terminate at [[Yongning Station|Yongning]] and [[Taipei Nangang Exhibition Center Station|Taipei Nangang Exhibition Center]]. [[Dingpu Station (Taipei Metro)|Dingpu]] is currently under construction and will become the other terminus of the line (replacing Yongning) when it is completed. It is expected to be operational in 2014. While current services run the full-length line from Yongning to Nangang, a shorter route from [[Far Eastern Hospital Station|Far Eastern Hospital]] to Taipei Nangang Exhibition Center is being run during rush hour traffic. ==History== *November 8, 1990: The Nangang Line begins construction. *December 30, 1991: The [[Taipei Station|Taipei Main Station]] western underground passageway opens. *December 24, 1993: Nangang Line construction at the intersection of [[Zhongxiao Road|Zhongxiao East Rd.]] and Shaoxing Rd. caves in, causes traffic jams. *October 30, 1998: Construction is completed on the tunnel between Kunyang and Houshanpi. *December 24, 1999: The segment from [[Taipei City Hall Station|Taipei City Hall]] to [[Longshan Temple Station|Longshan Temple]] begins revenue service.
